```{python}
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import pandas as pd


df = pd.read_csv('data/Dheeraj_data/national_arrests.csv')


traces = []
for offense in df.columns[1:]:  
    traces.append(go.Scatter(
        x=df['data_year'],
        y=df[offense],
        mode='lines',
        name=offense
    ))

fig = go.Figure(traces)


fig.update_layout(
    title='All Arrest by Offense Year-Over-Year',
    xaxis_title='Year',
    yaxis_title='Number of Arrests',
    hovermode='x unified'  
)


fig.show()


```


```{python}
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import pandas as pd


df = pd.read_csv('data/Dheeraj_data/national_arrests.csv')
# Create traces for each offense
traces = []
for offense in df.columns[1:]:  
    traces.append(go.Scatter(
        x=df['data_year'],
        y=df[offense],
        mode='lines+markers',  
        line=dict(width=2),  
        marker=dict(size=4),  
        text=offense,  
        hoverinfo='y+text'  
    ))


fig = go.Figure(traces)


fig.update_layout(
    title='All Arrest by Offense Year-Over-Year',
    xaxis_title='Year',
    yaxis_title='Number of Arrests',
    hovermode='closest',  
    legend=dict( 
        title=dict(text='Offenses'),
        orientation='h',  
        yanchor='bottom',
        y=1.02,  
        xanchor='right',
        x=1
    ),
    width=800, 
    height=600  
)

fig.add_vline(x=2020, line_width=2, line_dash="dash", line_color="red")


fig.add_annotation(
    x=2020, y=max(df.max()),  
    text="Start of COVID-19 impact",
    showarrow=True,
    arrowhead=1,
    ax=-50,
    ay=0
)


fig.update_traces(
    hoverlabel=dict(namelength=-1) 
)

# Show the plot
fig.show()



```
